item.title: George Orwell Explains in a Revealing 1944 Letter Why He'd Write 1984
item.description:
George Orwell Explains in a Revealing 1944 Letter Why He'd Write 1984

Most of the twentieth century's notable men of letters - i.e., writers of books, of essays, of reportage - seem also to have, literally, written a great deal of letters. Sometimes their correspondence reflects and shapes their "real" written work; sometimes it appears collected in book form itself.

item.title: Author M.R. Carey Is Writing a Prequel to Post-Apocalyptic Tale The Girl With All the Gifts
item.description:
Author M.R. Carey Is Writing a Prequel to Post-Apocalyptic Tale The Girl With All the Gifts

Great news for fans of M.R. Carey's The Girl With All the Gifts-a book that's about to enjoy a higher profile once the movie adaptation is out this fall. Carey announced he'll be writing another tale set in the same world, with the interesting twist that it'll be a prequel, rather than the expected sequel.

item.title: 6 distinctive doomsday bunkers for riding out the apocalypse
item.description:
6 distinctive doomsday bunkers for riding out the apocalypse

A lake house. A beachfront bungalow. A cabin in the woods. A two-bedroom timeshare outside of Scottsdale that you inherited from your grandmother. These are the second homes we can escape to when we need a breather, a recharge, a much-needed change of scenery. All of these getaways sound lovely - and not uncommon.

item.title: 'Fear The Walking Dead': Everything You Need To Know About The Season 2 Return
item.description:
'Fear The Walking Dead': Everything You Need To Know About The Season 2 Return

TV The Season 2 return of AMC's Fear The Walking Dead is only a week away. With that in mind, let's have a look at everything we know so far. Spoiler alert: This article discusses Season 2 of AMC's Fear The Walking Dead. Please proceed with caution if you wish to avoid spoilers.

item.title: What Does Nuclear Fallout Do To Your Body?
item.description:
What Does Nuclear Fallout Do To Your Body?

Relative to contemporary lists of Things To Worry About, nuclear fallout seems almost quaint these days. But it never hurts to be prepared. As several recent and disturbing fashion trends have indicated, the 1980s can recur at any time. In today's DNews special, Trace Dominguez digs through the isotopes of radioactive health concerns.

item.title: Armageddon strikes in first peek at Syfy's new post-apocalyptic series, Aftermath
item.description:
Armageddon strikes in first peek at Syfy's new post-apocalyptic series, Aftermath

Check out this intense teaser art for the upcoming Syfy series Aftermath, starring real-life couple Anne Heche and James Tupper as post-apocalyptic parents Karen and Joshua Copeland. Set against the harrowing backdrop of the world's end, this grim new promo poster paints a bleak future for our heroic survivors.

item.title: This is What Nuclear Fallout Could Look Like
item.description:
This is What Nuclear Fallout Could Look Like

Image: Future of Life Institute/NukeMap If you've never imagined what the devastating effects of nuclear fallout would look like, click any dot on this map. Future of Life Institute (FLI), a volunteer-run research group, has teamed up with Alex Wellerstein, a historian of science, to create interactive maps that visualizes the apocalyptic effects of a nuclear exchange between the US and Russia.

item.title: Dogs and Cats Rule in the Post-Apocalyptic Comic Book "Legend"
item.description:
Dogs and Cats Rule in the Post-Apocalyptic Comic Book "Legend"

Legend is a new comic book that imagines a post-apocalyptic world ruled by previously domesticated dogs and cats. The project, which mixes up science-fiction, fantasy, horror, and social commentary, is the brainchild of writer Sam Sattin and artist Chris Koehler. The tale focuses on the exploits of Legend, the comic's namesake English Pointer, and faithful ...

item.title: Alienation: A Post-Apocalyptic Short Film
item.description:
Alienation: A Post-Apocalyptic Short Film

This short film tackles the real issues that a person might face in the post-apocalypse. This video explores a post-apocalyptic Australia, where a 35-year-old man, Lorne, faces life after his son's death and an alien invasion has destroyed much of the world. He encounters a young 10-year-old b...

item.title: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OR HUMANITY: WHICH IS A GREATER THREAT TO OUR SURVIVAL? - toki-woki
item.description:
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OR HUMANITY: WHICH IS A GREATER THREAT TO OUR SURVIVAL? - toki-woki

Artificial Intelligence or Humanity: Which Is a Greater Threat to Our Survival? : Our technologies may be more powerful than ever, but what is the real threat to our future? Here, Oxford Artificial Intelligence professor Nigel Shadbolt investigates. The Age of The AI Artificial Intelligence (AI) is enjoying one of its periodic moments in the limelight.
